title: Deadlock just shuffled everyone into new ranked leagues overnight, but players suspect matchmaking won't feel any different: 'If you were miserable before, you'll still be miserable now'
summary: Fly through 20 divisions after your last match? It's not just you.
body: I've never played an invite-only beta test with such a fully-formed ranking system as Deadlock's, but I guess when everyone gets unlimited plus-ones, the audience is big enough to warrant it. Besides, the game's beta status didn't stop me lamenting my place in Arcanist IVโbelow average, assuming ranks fall into normal distributionโbut a patch dropped yesterday that majorly shook up everyone's ranked placements, leaving me three full leagues ahead of where I was and terrified for my next solo queue. To my surprise, though, the update wasn't to the matchmaker, but to the ranked badge system. As developer Yoshi put it on the Deadlock Discord: "Previously, badges were tied to fixed skill ranges on the backend, rather than percentiles. As new players joined and as the distribution shifted over time, it caused badges to clump up in negative ways. You can head over to your profile now to see your rebalanced badge." Players did exactly that, of course, and the Deadlock subreddit is ablaze with players who had similar leaps to my own. Reddit user YunusES said, "Bro I got sent to fucking Phantom 4 from Emissary 4, I'm scared to even search for a game." Sharing a similar anxiety, user Papalmโฆ
